channel.title: How did
channel.description: MITB make it so on all the forums it has same login info, statistics on bottom, etc. I tried making two smf accounts under the same database (with diff prefixes) and it didnt work. I guess nothings that easy :P. well im a beginner, but all help appreciated.

item.title: How did
item.dc:creator: @Dunder_Mifflin1 Dunder Mifflin
item.description:
@Dunder_Mifflin1 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:12, topic:443545”]OH so the "main " subboard is mitb and all the others are sort of “subboarding” from that?

Pretty ingenious.[/quote]

precisely

Read full topic

item.title: How did
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Loveandpower:

ah I misworded that. What I meant to ask was do both forums that are being integrated have to have the same version?

Well you aren’t integrating two forums. The other websites are just ‘subforums’ that link to the main forum. In this case, moparisthebest.com/smf is literally 3 files (as I recall, there’s index.php, agreement.txt, and probably SSI.php). Everything else exists wherever the moparisthebest.com/smf forum does.

Read full topic

item.title: How did
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:

item.title: How did
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:8, topic:443545”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=546224.msg4004498#msg4004498 date=1338474926]
http://custom.simplemachines.org/mods/index.php?mod=2137

Have fun. You may need to update it and, as I am aware, at least two other SMF mod authors created replacements for this mod with a much different way of doing it. Mine has some fundamental flaws, but they are fixable and it should work with newer SMF versions with few changes. As far as those newer mods are concerned, I don’t think they work in the exact same way as mine does, so they may not achieve exactly what you want. Either way, it helps to look around a bit.
[/quote]so does mopar use 2.0 rc version?[/quote]

It says on the bottom of the site what the forum uses.

Read full topic

item.title: How did
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

it’s a simple. if you set up a mirror in front of the main servers motherboard flux capacitor at the right angle, it will reflect the digital light rays and therefore transfer the desired information to the other server nearby. this subject is covered in detail by the award winning documentary, ‘Star Wars’.

Read full topic
